Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.<p><br></p>Today’s world is fueled by vast amounts of information. Data is more valuable than ever before. Protecting data and information systems is central to doing business, and everyone in EY Information Security has a critical role to play. Join a global team of almost 950 people who collaborate to support the business of EY by protecting EY and client information assets! Our Information Security professionals enable EY to work securely and deliver secure products and services, as well as detect and quickly respond to security events as they happen. Together, the efforts of our dedicated team help protect the EY brand and build client trust.<p><br></p>Within Information Security we blend risk strategy, digital identity, cyber defense, application security and technology solutions as we consider the entire security lifecycle. You will join a team of hardworking, security-focused individuals dedicated to supporting, protecting and enabling the business through innovative, secure solutions that provide speed to market and business value.<p><br></p><strong>The opportunity</strong><p><br></p>The Encryption Engineer will be a member of the Digital Certificate Technology Services team within the Information Security Identity and Access Management Services (IAMS) team. This Engineer will deploy, configure and maintain centralized key management services to provide end-to-end lifecycle management, governance and security of sensitive key material.<p><br></p><strong>Your Key Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p>Deploy and configure enterprise key management and hardware security module (HSM) tools, which will centralize key lifecycle administration across the global EY platform for data at rest and data in transit. As such, candidates must possess:<p><br></p><ul><li>Experience with Key Management Life Cycle - Key Generation, Storage, Distribution, Backup, Rotation, Revocation, Destruction, etc.</li><li>Experience with major enterprise key management systems as well as cloud-based key management services.</li><li>Hands on experience and knowledge of TLS, PKI, HSMs, KMIP, Digital Certificate Management, Azure Key Vault, and transparent database encryption.</li><li>Experience with FIPS 140-2 compliance requirements and implementation.</li><li>Experience in security key management, security standards, cryptography, certificate management lifecycle and PKI.</li><li>Understanding of cloud computing architecture, technical design, and implementation.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>To qualify for the role, you must have</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or 8 years Security Engineering Experience or equivalent.</li><li>5+ years’ experience in enterprise key management, HSM configuration, application layer encryption, and transparent data encryption.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Ideally, you’ll also have</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience working with diverse, globally distributed teams.</li><li>Ability to work well in a highly matrixed environment yet builds credibility to drive execution outside of direct chain of command while working across all organizational levels.</li><li>Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.</li><li>A security industry certification such as Security+, Network+, Cryptography Certification. </li><li>Ability to work independently or with a team, under minimum supervision.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What We Look For</strong><p><br></p>A successful candidate for this role would be expected to be a problem solver with the ability to assess situations from multiple perspectives. They will demonstrate persistence, originality and ability to apply technical concepts to solve complex business challenges. The ability to network with key stakeholders and sponsors, work across multiple teams, make sense of complexity and uncertainty, recognize and navigate issues, articulate thoughts and opinions, assert pragmatic ideas and influence, and present to a variety of audiences are required characteristics of the successful candidate.<p><br></p><strong>What We Offer</strong><p><br></p>The compensation ranges below are provided in order to comply with United States pay transparency laws. Other geographies will follow their local salary guidelines, which may not be a direct conversion of published US salary range/s.<p><br></p>We offer a comprehensive compensation and benefits package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to the business. The salary range for this job in most geographic locations in the US is $126,800 to $0230,100. The salary range for New York City Metro Area, Washington State and California (excluding Sacramento) is $0152,200 to $261,500. Individual salaries within those ranges are determined through a wide variety of factors including but not limited to education, experience, knowledge, skills and geography. In addition, our Total Rewards package includes medical and dental coverage, pension and 401(k) plans, and a wide range of paid time off options. Under our flexible vacation policy, you’ll decide how much vacation time you need based on your own personal circumstances. You’ll also be granted time off for designated EY Paid Holidays, Winter/Summer breaks, Personal/Family Care, and other leaves of absence when needed to support your physical, financial, and emotional well-being.<p><br></p><ul><li>Continuous learning: You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.</li><li>Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.</li><li>Transformative leadership: We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.</li><li>Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please apply to this role only through the ‘Apply’ link (not through the local office). Your application will then be routed to the appropriate recruiting team. </strong><p><br></p><strong>The Exceptional EY Experience. description: <strong>Title </strong><p><br></p>Software Engineers &amp; Architects – Java / .Net / Mobile<p><br></p><strong>Overview</strong><p><br></p>Daugherty Business Solutions is looking for Software Engineers (developers and architects) of <strong>all levels </strong>with a broad range of languages who can adapt to new client environments and learn new technologies quickly.<p><br></p>We are looking for full-stack developers, but also consultants with deep expertise in specific modern technologies. We always want people to apply what they know, but if you don’t know a particular technology of interest, we provide vast opportunities to learn new capabilities.<p><br></p>Daugherty will work with our employees to support preferred work locations, whether from home / remote, hybrid, in-office, or some other combination that still works with our clients’ expectations.<p><br></p>We prefer our consultants to be located in the Eastern, Central, or Mountain timezones within the United States.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Designing, developing, and testing application code. </li><li> Solving problems using modern languages and frameworks. </li><li> Working with business analysts to understand and implement complex business functionality. </li><li> Creating well-designed, well-implemented data layers. </li><li> Being a member of an Agile team (standups, estimation, iterative development CI, demos, retrospectives). </li><li> Collaborating with DevOps, Release Engineering, and Operations to automate deployments. </li><li> Analyzing application specifications and technology approaches to ensure business requirements are met and scalable for future product releases. </li><li> Managing a team of developers and analysts throughout the entire product lifecycle. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications</strong><p><br></p>Interested in joining our Team Daugherty? Here are a few things that we look for in a teammate:<p><br></p><ul><li> Passion for software development with a strong customer focus. </li><li> Excitement to learn and work with technologies and languages such as: </li></ul><p><br></p>Java, JavaScript, React, Node, Vue, Spring, .Net, Azure, AWS, Kubernetes, Google Cloud, Angular, Python, Mobile (iOS/Swift and Android), Microservices, Scala, Golang, TypeScript, HTML, SQL Server, Oracle, CSS and more!<p><br></p><ul><li> Enjoy a fast-paced and challenging, but extremely collaborative team environment working to solve complex problems for our clients. </li><li> Passionate problem-solvers who are creative, flexible, adaptable, and motivated. </li><li> Eagerness for learning newer and varying technologies. </li><li> Enjoy helping others succeed… our clients AND our team members. </li><li> Bring a consultative mindset… looking for problems to solve and helping solve them together. </li><li> Preferred: College degree or equivalent in technology-related field (computer science, engineering, information technology, etc.). </li><li> Practical education or experience in a technology related field – could include bootcamps and focused educational programs. </li><li> Project experience in delivering technology solutions in a team-based environment, ideally Agile development. </li></ul><p><br></p>Compensation Range<p><br></p>Negotiable<p><br></p><strong>About Daugherty Business Solutions</strong><p><br></p>Daugherty Business Solutions brings a fresh approach to consulting by rolling up our sleeves and working with our clients—collaborating to solve some of their most pressing business challenges. We deliver results. This is why many of the most well-known companies in the world trust us with their mission-critical projects and why working at Daugherty is for the smart, the talented, and the curious.<p><br></p>Life at Daugherty isn’t like your typical consulting job. Every team member plays an integral role in our company’s success, and we treat you that way, starting with our culture.<p><br></p>In our Dev Center, specifically, we like to say that we have the culture of a startup with the security of a 35+ year old company. By that, it's a casual, relaxed agile shop focused on helping you create your best work. (And - A casual dress code is just one part of that success.) The other side... Our consultants work in the cities they live, and you don’t have to worry about your job ending when an engagement is complete.<p><br></p>What We Commit to YOU<p><br></p><ul><li> We provide a multitude of training opportunities, from Hackathons, Lunch and Learns, free access to Pluralsight and Safari Library. </li><li> You will get to work with some of the most innovative teams in the IT marketplace and solve real strategic problems. </li><li> We will invest in things that are important to you both professionally and personally. </li><li> We will provide you with a team environment like no other – and we prove that, as we consistently rank as a Top Workplace in many of our locations as voted by our own employees. </li><li> We will build a relationship with you to accelerate your Career. </li><li> We provide some of the best benefits around. </li></ul><p><br></p>We offer members of Team Daugherty<p><br></p><ul><li> Excellent health, dental, and vision insurance. </li><li> Revenue sharing and a 401(k) retirement savings. </li><li> Life, disability, and long-term care insurance. </li><li> No travel / remote work. </li><li> Robust career development and extensive training. </li></ul><p><br></p>Daugherty Business Solutions is an inclusive Equal Employment Opportunity employer that considers applicants without regard to gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, disabled or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.<p><br></p>Due to COVID-19, most of our employees are working remotely. We’ve implemented a virtual hiring process and continue to interview candidates by phone or video and are onboarding new hires remotely. We value the safety of each member of our community because we know we’re all in this together.<p><br></p>If you require accommodations or assistance to complete the online application process, please inform any recruiter you are working with (or send an email to careers@daugherty.com) and identify the type of accommodation or assistance you are requesting. Do not include any medical or health information in this email. The recruiting team will respond to your email promptly.<p><br></p>
